thread.title: Want 3D Touch on your Android Device? Synaptics has the Solution
thread.title_full: Want 3D Touch on your Android Device? Synaptics has the Solution

author: Aaron Richardson
title: Want 3D Touch on your Android Device? Synaptics has the Solution
text:
Twitter 
One of the most important updates to the iPhone 6s is the new 3D touch display which adds a level of pressure sensitivity so more in-depth actions can be performed. It’s a cracking feature, but for those dedicated to the Google -side of things, it’s just not an option. Fortunately, a new Synaptics controller set to bring 3D Touch to Android . 
The engineering boffins over at Synaptics have cleverly been able to create a touchscreen controller called the ClearPad 3700, which cleverly mimics the 3D Touch capabilities with “variably force sensing” called ClearForce. 
If that wasn’t enough, they’ve also created technology called SideTouch, which allows the user to use the bezels of their phone to scroll and select, allowing to to see what’s on screen while scrolling. 
It’s worth noting though that while this technology now exists, it won’t be going into production until the end of the year, and even then manufacturers looking to use this technology will have to use it in an innovative way unless they want the wrath of Apple coming down on them. 
We could see devices with this technology by 2016, but I have my doubts. TAGS
